info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 7:11AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Whiteside, southeastern Carroll, northeastern Rock Island, northeastern Scott and southeastern Clinton Counties through 745 AM CDT... At 711 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albany, or near Clinton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fulton and East Clinton around 715 AM CDT. Garden Plain around 720 AM CDT. Morrison around 730 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lyndon, Sterling, Rock Falls, Coleta and Emerson. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 20 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
